intro: Rondeletia alaternoides, commonly known as the red rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
